mineSweeper

Class MenuPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • mineSweeper.MenuPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class MenuPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Author:
    Tom Leibovich and Roee Shachar MenuPanel is a menu that is visible at any time during the game. It has many design fields that make configurations easier in case of maintenance and changes.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MenuPanel

        public MenuPanel(Main parentFrame,
         int screenHeight,
         int screenWidth)
        The single constructor creates all of the graphical objects adds them in a grid bag layout and shows them.
        Parameters:
        parentFrame - the parent is the frame containing this panel.
        screenHeight - screen height
        screenWidth - screen width

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        this method is called by the timer. it updates the seconds every 1 second.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • newRecord

        public void newRecord()
        this method is called when the player wins.

      • setTimerText

        public void setTimerText(int seconds)
        This method sets the timer text field with the seconds past in a clock format. i.e: mm:ss
        Parameters:
        seconds - the seconds past the beginning of the game

      • startTimer

        public void startTimer()
        initializes the timer. if a timer already exists it stops it and remove the listener from it.

      • stopTimer

        public void stopTimer()
        stops the timer.

      • updateMinesLeft

        public void updateMinesLeft(int minesLeft)
        updates the text field "mines".
        Parameters:
        minesLeft - the number of mines minus the number of flags.
